body_html:
TensorFlow only has official Ubuntu support.
For CentOS, we have not tested our pip packages.

Possible issues that come to my mind, did you check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, does it include the directory /usr/local/cuda/lib64/ ?
If not, could you try adding that folder to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and try again?
body_text:
TensorFlow only has official Ubuntu support.
For CentOS, we have not tested our pip packages.
Possible issues that come to my mind, did you check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, does it include the directory /usr/local/cuda/lib64/ ?
If not, could you try adding that folder to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and try again?
body:
TensorFlow only has official Ubuntu support.
For CentOS, we have not tested our pip packages.

Possible issues that come to my mind, did you check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, does it include the directory /usr/local/cuda/lib64/ ?
If not, could you try adding that folder to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and try again?
